intro: Spermacoce dasycephala, commonly known as the hairy-headed sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with alternate leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds, aiding in its propagation across various habitats.
